Booked reservations before a Broadway show months in advance. Arrived early to find a huge line in which we would have to wait well over an hour. We left. The worst NYC restaurant experience I've had. Will not try again.

I had high expectations for this restaurant but unfortunately they werenâ€™t met. The portions are incredibly large and whilst I understand they are supposed to be shared, they could not accommodate for me and the other person I was with. They charged us 150 dollars for a steak for two, and although it was a relatively good steak it was NOT worth the price.  For dessert, we ordered tiramisu. Although staff knew this was our first time here, we were not warned of the size (it could easily serve a family of 7) - we couldnâ€™t even finish half, and were charged 30 dollars for it. If you choose to go, make sure you pre-read because there are no prices on their menu and THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF. Yes, their food is decent but they are stealing your money. Bathrooms also arenâ€™t super clean.
Family style, love it!

If youâ€™re in New York City and want a dining experience that defines Italian family-style perfection, Carmineâ€™s in Times Square is an absolute must. The food here is nothing short of spectacular, rich, flavorful, and made for sharing with the people you love.

The Chicken Parmigiana is a showstopper, perfectly breaded, smothered in tangy marinara, and topped with just the right amount of melted cheese. The Rigatoni with Vodka Sauce is another crowd favorite, creamy, bold, and loaded with flavor that hits every note of comfort and indulgence. And if you want to go big, donâ€™t miss the Lobster Fra Diavolo, a jaw-dropping dish thatâ€™s as delicious as it is impressive, drenched in a spicy tomato sauce and served over a mountain of pasta.

Pair your meal with a classic red wine, a refreshing Aperol Spritz, or one of their signature sangrias, each one crafted to complement the hearty Italian flavors perfectly.

From the lively atmosphere to the generous portions and exceptional service, Carmineâ€™s delivers every time. Whether itâ€™s your first visit or your fiftieth, it feels like Sunday dinner at an Italian familyâ€™s home, just bigger, louder, and full of unforgettable flavor.

Review â€“ Carmineâ€™s (Times Square, NYC)

Carmineâ€™s is a classic Italian restaurant right in the heart of Times Square, and itâ€™s absolutely a must-go if youâ€™re in the area. The place has that old-school Italian charm â€”bustling, lively, and full of energyâ€” perfect for groups or family-style dining.

The portions are enormous. Seriously, one dish can easily serve three to five people. We were two and ordered a lasagna, which could have fed four hungry diners without a problem. The flavors were rich and comforting, exactly what youâ€™d expect from a great Italian spot.

The service is outstanding â€”friendly, efficient, and perfectly coordinated, even though the restaurant is huge and always busy. Iâ€™d recommend making a reservation, but even if you donâ€™t, the staff handles everything very smoothly.

Prices are extremely reasonable, especially considering the portion sizes and location. We were so full we couldnâ€™t even think about dessert â€”a rare thing!

ğŸ“ Conclusion:
Carmineâ€™s is an NYC institution that delivers big flavor, big portions, and great service. Ideal for sharing and enjoying a true Italian-American dining experience.
